Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Gwyneth77
Reviews.Content: This is a modern, newly and well equipped, very clean and inexpensive hotel in central Berlin, just a few minutes walk from the museums Neue Nationalgalerie or Gemäldegalerie, 15 minutes walk to the Potsdamer Platz (subway station) or 5 minutes to the subway station Kurfürstenstraße. My room to the rear yard was comfortable and very quiet, the staff friendly, breakfast simple but OK. There is free Wi-Fi. What else would you ask from a hotel? I will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern place”
Reviews.Author: Anna K
Reviews.Content: Very good modern hotel with great nutritious breakfast (no hot dishes except boiled eggs). The room is decorated in a modern way. Furniture looks nice. We had a spacious room with big bathroom. The staff was not very friendly but helpful. None of receptionists could help us to find places or destinations we needed. The room was clean every day and the towels changed. We liked the breakfast - you can eat and drink as much as you can so it helps to stay full most part of the day. It was quiet, we didn't hear guests next door. The location is safe despite turkish area around. Underground and bus stations are few minutes away from the hotel. The reception is closed On the whole this place is great and cheap to stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Glenn22
Reviews.Content: Small room (pretty usual in Europe) but very modern, clean, sylish and comfortable. Good design. Well located and at a very good price for such a central location. The only negative is that the pillows were pretty small/flat (also common in Europe) but we were able to get two extras when we asked.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base.”
Reviews.Author: talofa91
Reviews.Content: Hotel was conveniently located between two metro stops. If you walk north about ten minutes there is the Potsdamer Platz bahnhof, or you can walk south less than five minutes and reach the Kurfürstenstraße U-bahn stop. I felt very safe in the neighborhood the hotel was in. Rooms were small but clean (pillows were only thing that I didn't like, too small), free wifi was a plus but you need SMS txt messaging to get the code‎ for it. You can conveniently self check-in at a kiosk in the hotel and checkout is not necessary as you are given a room code and not a card key. I highly recommend the small Joseph-Roth-Diele restaurant right across from the hotel for a lovely setting and excellent meal.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern Hotel. Large rooms. Little far from Berlin Postdamer Platz.”
Reviews.Author: Joana70
Reviews.Content: The BB hotel was very modern and trendy. The reception personnel needs to work the foreign languagues. Breakfast was very good and not to expensive. The rooms were large for family, have only the necessarie, very good heating specially when outside was snowing. The negative review is only the location, because its a bit far from Berlin Postdamer Platz, we have to catch the bus to reach the square and only there we can catch the Ubahn (subway).

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made Berlin even more perfect”
Reviews.Author: dikdaan
Reviews.Content: Berlin on it's own is a wonderful city, coming home to a clean friendly hotel (albeit budget) is even better. There is 2 Ubahn stations very close by, but Potsdamer Platz is only a 10 minute walk away. Whenever I got to Europe now I will look for these hotels first, but definately go back to this one in Berlin. Yes it's Budget, which normally means tacky NOT B&B. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Staff very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: molewood
Reviews.Content: Although this is a basic hotel, it is new and very clean and with free wireless internet access. I described hotel as an upmarket Mister Bed, if you are familiar with that chain. Our room was on mainroad side but the double glazing kept noise out. The photos shown above do reflect the hotel accurately. One problem was that room was very hot and A/c did not seem to make any difference. Reported it to staff who said they would check it. Reasonable cold buffet breakfast (6Euro). Also a good cafe right across the road for a meal. About 15 mins walk from Potsdamer Platz U-bahn. Kurfurstenstrasse U-bahn much nearer but it was closed (would have been useful if B&B website has warned us of that before we arrived there!). Bought City WelcomeCards from hotel for our travel (Berlin has very easy and extensive public transport system) and entry discounts.

Reviews.Title: “What a deal!”
Reviews.Author: dagpel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not a B&B as many people might suspect when they see the name. It is a regular hotel with squeaky clean rooms, good service, friendly personnel. It is a chain establishment, and after our first experience in Berlin, we would stay in othr B&B hotels wherever they are available. The Berlin B&B is walking distance from galleries and museums, Brandenburg Tor, Haulocost Museum, the Sony Center, Tiergarten, great restaurants, and many shops. Breakfast is not included in the price, but we highly recommend it for the 6 something Euros it costs. The food selection is incredible and fresh, and you won't need lunch! And certainly the price is more than right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: eesti919
Reviews.Content: I spent total of 3 nights in that hotel and I enjoyed it very much. Although our room wasn't cleaned when we arrived, it was cleaned very fast after the notice to the staff. Personnel was very friendly and helpful, unlike someone commented before... I noticed something strange about WiFi though (ipod touch) - First two nights my WiFi wasn't working correctly. I had to reconnect all the time, but at a return trip, the WiFi was working perfectly. Room was very nice with ampelmanns on the wall and conditioner, although TV was too small for me ( ~19-20 inches). Double -room had two beds that can be connected to one big bed. Toilet was quite nice, but the soap was only in the shower, so i had to take it from there - something what to change ;) Hotel is located about 10 -minute walk from a Potsdamer-Platz in a something that i would describe as a Turkish area - nothing bad about it though... Breakfast was a typical one - nothing exciting. But you would like to have something more than just a bread + jam/butter/cheese, ham and coffee etc.

Reviews.Title: “Personnel is arrogant and rude”
Reviews.Author: burningmax
Reviews.Content: While the hotel looks nice and has a good location, the personnel of the hotel is very rude and will force you to leave the room at check-out in a very rude way. They didn't kept my luggage in storage for the rest of the day, and have lacked politeness all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price conscious”
Reviews.Author: Sinppu
Reviews.Content: We spent two great nights here in June. Price is unbeatable, rooms are bright and clean. Everything is new and the location is all right, two metro stops are a few minutes walk away. I'd give it a third star if I could. Free Internet is always a bonus. Loved it, for the price it's a real bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to the city center”
Reviews.Author: Traumreisen
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody who wants a nice, clean, inexpensive hotel room in a brand new hotel close to the city center. Walking distance to the Potsdamer Platz is about 12 minutes. Bus stop is very close to the hotel. We did not book the breakfast but it also is not expensive and looked good. Only the room size for 2 people might be not that perfect. But for that price and location more then great!

HotelInfo.Name: B&B Hotel Berlin-Potsdamer Platz
HotelInfo.Address: Potsdamer Strasse 90, 10785 Berlin, Germany
